title: Please hotfix Nasus' Q Bug
body:
This is probably honestly responsible for his drop in winrate by 5%. It's literally ruining his teamfight whenever he switches targets, there's times where his Q won't register at all even when his Q animation shows it hits. This isn't me reporting a bug, this is a known bug that Riot has stated they already have a fix for. Why are you waiting until 5.18? This is a game breaking bug for Nasus, if you already have a fix, just patch it in. What happens if it turns out the fix isn't even fixed? What happens if you wait until 5.18 and it's still bugged? Are you going to wait to 5.19? Please, just fix it now. It's making playing him miserable.

Reposting here because I was told Gameplay and Balance is the wrong board for asking for a hotfix on a known bug with an intended fix for the next patch because it's a gamebreaking issue gameplay wise for Nasus. What great mods we have.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Riscx,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=cqnWYtXG,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2015-09-10T20:31:49.668+0000)

> We haven't redeployed this because it would cause a decent sized client download for **all** players - and the bug is completely avoidable if you just don't swap targets mid-Q animation. It will be fixed in 5.18 next week.

I don't usually like to do this, but the fact that this has been stated in every (or at least most) post about the hotfix means that this isn't a one off comment said in the moment, but something that Riot (or at least some Rioters) believe is not offensive to people who play Nasus. Yes in an ideal world you won't switch targets mid Q. In the real world it is hard not to do while playing the game, even when you are actively trying to avoid it. That this statement has been added as work around in every (or at least most) post about the bug is really tone deaf to the players who play Nasus as it implies if you are experiencing this bug it is your fault.

In the future you are better off not explaining how to avoid a bug or give a work around when even the most vigilant of player will accidentally trigger it at least once a game (most likely in times of high action such as a teamfight).
They are going to fix it so by no means are you being offered a solution in that, but in the meantime it's something to take into consideration.

I would like them to fix it. But I am not asking them to fix it with that post.

I am asking them to try to not be condescending when posting. Because the post (and others they have posted about the bug) clearly reads as if you experience this bug its your own fault.

I'm not trying to sound Biased or anything here, but I bet that if there was a bug where jumping to Zed's shadow instantly froze him in place for 3+ seconds you'd fix it instantly even if it has this big of a patch. And to use your excuse back at you, if we had that, I could say, "Just wait half a second."

Zed is also not a tank that has the potential to literally 1 shot ANYTHING IN THE GAME. In truth it is a bug that should be fixed, but it is just hard for me to feel bad when he is already potentially so broken. Wither at max rank might as well be a permanent stun unless you have {{item:3140}} and then you only have a few seconds before he simply casts it again. In a game i was literally withered, it fell off, i took two steps, and I was withered again. This champion already will undoubtedly carry the late game if the player isn't too brain dead to press Q. His ult makes him even tankier than he already is. He can literally build full tank items and do the most damage in the game.

Nasus needs time to get his stacks. Anyone who can make him afraid to CS just pretty much makes him useless for a good while. Wither is strong, sure. But it can only be on one target. There are assassins with better CC than Nasus does.

And just saying as a Nasus player, he's a mid-game champion, not late. Late-game he gets kited too easily by the full build teams and dies up. Mid-game you  have a lot of your power while your opponents are still building up.

And as a last note, Azir was a really powerful mid laner on release. His bugs made him unplayable though. Do you think Azir was justified to be m ore of a bug than what {{champion:121}} could dream of?
Nasus being strong is not an excuse to leave a gamebreaking issue for him in the game.

Also with the Juggernauts being in their current state Nasus is unplayable. CSing outside of your turret means either taking true damage, being out sustained, or just simply chunked. Nasus almost seems like a champ that's intentionally designed to lose lane, get zoned from his minions, in exchange for the _possibility_ of being a late game terror.
He is...

He's designed to have a tough time during lane, and almost no ability to be a lane bully. Against Juggernauts, he's guaranteed to lose lane assuming they know how their champion works. It makes sense for a champion to be weak early and strong late, but having around ten champions that guarantee a lost lane is poor design, even better when at least 3 of them are very strong picks in general at the time because of a balance lapse on Riot's part.

Granted the idea of a champion with infinitely scaling damage like Nasus' Q is a piece of poor design that prompted him being designed poorly in lane in the first place. Nasus seems like one of those wonky characters that oozes with "I was designed before design made sense and was never updated".

Pretty much this, tbh.

It's sad to say, but Nasus is not very well designed. He goes from ''Well I can't do much as Nasus'' to ''Well I can't do much against Nasus''. It's possible to make both cases less frustrating (buff his AA range, increase his early sustain, reduce the range or effecitveness of his point and click slow, make him more kiteable, etc.) but overall he's just... weird in a bad sense.

He's already extremely kitable and contrary to popular belief, he's not even good late game because he just gets kited into oblivion and dies really fast since carries will have %pen and he won't have a significant level advantage. Nasus is basically a mid game champ with tools that allow him to scale into an unstoppable duelist, which doesn't since it's impossible to reliably split push given how good iniation is atm.

Just wanna point out that I never said anything about his late game, just how I perceive the scale that is playing as/against Nasus.

Nasus' kit doesn't call for much interaction. You can kite? You're golden. You can't? Does he deal more damage than you? You're screwed. He doesn't? You're golden.


Compare to champs like {{champion:61}} that can always outplay you unless she's massively behind (and even then she can still set up her team mates for wombo combos, make allies into initiators or just peel and support) and can always be outplayed even when ridiculously ahead and you'll understand why IMO Nasus is badly designed.

Not every champion needs to have Orianna levels of interaction/counterplay. Nasus has his niche, and he's balanced around it. Sometimes simplicity is the key to brilliance; if you consider the recent trend of overloaded CertainlyT-esque kit designs (*cough* Ekko *cough*), Nasus is especially refreshing in comparison.
